p.b: As most of you know Governor Parsons has declared all public schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year. The staff and school board are deeply saddened by the closure, but we understand and support the decision. Our #1 priority is the safety of all our students.

School Work: We will continue providing assignments until May 15th. All assignments will need to be turned into the bins in front of the building or sent by Dojo to the teacher for grading. It is important that students keep working on ALL assignments up until May 15th.

Lunches: Lunches will continue to be distributed throughout the school closure. Remember the meals will be available Monday and Thursday. If you have any questions concerning meals, please call the school office between 8 am and 12 pm; Monday through Friday.

8th grade Students: We realize you have put a great deal of effort into your studies that last several years. We still want to honor you. Our hope is to have some type of graduation ceremony, possibly later this summer. We will monitor the Governor's directions, but hopefully can find a date to make a ceremony work.
Please stay safe and if you have any questions, please do not hesitate to call our office. (573)-435-6293.

div.p: *****Due to Governor Parsons "Stay at home" order; we will only delivering and having pick up time on MONDAY and THURSDAY. *****
**Monday will have meals for Tuesday and Wednesday as well.
**Thursday will have meals for Friday as well.
Please stay safe and healthy during this time!

Due to COVID-19 (Coronavirus) our district felt it was best to cancel based on the information received by Phelps County and Texas County Health Departments. With that said, we have provided school work packets for your child to complete and return for a grade. On the school page tab/class page, each teacher has links as well as their newsletters to provide additional assignments. We are also providing additional educational sites that your child would be able to access during this difficult time.

Scholastic is providing curriculum like studies on a day to day basis along with stories, videos, and puzzles for your child to explore. This is FREE!! We have found out that this website needs to be opened in Google Chrome for all the books to load. Sorry for the inconvenience!!
Bed Time Math is a FREE website that provides family fun math activities that you can print and create hands on games that fit your individual family.
Sci Jinks: NASA and NOAA's weather site for kids- you child can play games and get all their questions answered about weather with the videos that are provided. This is also a FREE site.
Smithsonian's Weather Lab: is a interactive weather lab. This has very interesting videos for grades 3rd- 8th grade. FREE site as well.
Web Weather for kids: This is more geared for students 3rd grade and younger. They can learn about tornadoes/thunderstorms, hurricanes, etc. Also, has science experiments. FREE site
Never-Ending Science: Links to webcams of beehives, eagle nests, meerkats, and more. Virtual tours, and the Smithsonian and much more. This is a FREE site.

Brain Pop and Brain Pop Jr. are usually a site you need to pay for but due to the school closings, this site will be FREE as long as schools are closed. You will be asked to sign up to receive free access and you will need to create a username and password. Then you will be granted access.
www.brainpop.com and www.brainpopjr.com

EPIC! is a virtual children's reading site. This has 35,000 books in its library, along with learning videos and quizzes. This site has a 30 day FREE trial and after the free trial you would be required to pay $7.99 a month for unlimited access. However, you may CANCEL at any time!
In case of inclement weather, our school cancellations will be posted on KOLR/KOZL, KY3, and FOX 2/News 11 television stations and KZZN/KTTR radio stations.
Cancellation notifications will also be sent via School Messenger and you will continue to get calls, texts, and emails.
If you have any questions or need to update information please call 573-435-6293.
**Beginning on Wednesday, March 18th, school WILL NOT be in session and all after school activities will be cancelled. School will resume Monday, March 30th.
**Tomorrow students will be bringing assignments and library books to work on at home during the extended break.**

Phelps County R-III School District is located in rural Phelps County. The school serves grades PreK - 8 with a student population of approximately 200. The school is served by a Board of Education that truly believes in the students and an education that prepares the students for becoming lifelong learners. Our staff, faculty members, and administrator work together to create a family atmosphere where everyone enjoys learning - children and adults. Our community families work together to support those learning endeavors.
